items.title: These five PSUs are eligible to exit under SEBI's new relaxed delisting norms
items.description: The five eligible companies are KIOCL, HMT, ITI, State Trading Corporation and Fertilisers & Chemicals Travancore.

items.title: HPCL, BPCL, IOC slip as Brent inches towards $77 amid escalating Iran-Israel war, ONGC shares rise
items.description: OMC stocks: The rising tensions in the oil-rich Middle East has triggered supply disruption concerns, which in turn boosted oil prices.

items.title: Taking Stock: Sensex, Nifty end lower in rangebound session; broader indices worst hit
items.description: Broader indices underperform the main indices with BSE Midcap and Smallcap falling more than 1.5 percent each.

items.title: PPFAS MF Buys 7.27% Stake in Zydus Wellness Via Open Market
items.description: PPFAS MF Buys 7.27% Stake in Zydus Wellness Via Open Market

items.title: Dreamfolks denies partnership cancellations after report said banks and card network sought direct pact with airport lounges
items.description: The management of Dreamfolks told CNBC-TV18 that the news report is 'incorrect' there has been no cancellations in its partnership with clients, and its relations with all partners remain 'strong and fully intact'.

items.title: Nifty Fails To Defend 24,800 On Weekly Expiry Day; Midcaps Face Selling Pressure| Closing Bell Live
items.description: Nifty Holds 24,800 On Weekly Expiry Day. Frontline indices steady; Midcaps Face Selling Pressure. Breadth extremely poor; NSE Advance-decline ratio at 1:5. Auto only sectoral gainer; Metals & IT extend losses. Catch Nandita Khemka and Yatin Mota as they discuss stocks on their radar.

items.title: MTAR Technologies rebounds 3% after securing 10-year contract with Weatherford
items.description: Mtar Tech share price: The order will be executed from a new facility in Adibatla, Telangana, which is expected to become operational by June 2026.

items.title: Adani Ports shares fall 2.3%, extend decline to 9% in seven sessions amid escalating Israel-Iran conflict
items.description: Adani Ports owns a majority stake in Haifa Port in Israel. The company had acquired the port for a total consideration of $1.18 billion in 2023. The port is one of Israel’s major seaports.

items.title: Mid, smallcap indices plunge 2%, extend losses for 3rd day amid broad-based selling: IREDA, RVNL, FirstCry among top losers
items.description: Broader markets: The Nifty Midcap index dropped over 1.5 percent to hover around 57,206, while the Nifty Smallcap index fell nearly 2 percent to stand at 18,018 in the afternoon.

items.title: Listed for years, still these PSUs have not complied with public shareholding norm: Here's why
items.description: Some of the PSUs like Madras Fertilizers, New India Assurance, Mangalore Refinery, MMTC, ITI, HMT, UCO Bank, Central Bank of India, and IDBI Bank among others had a promoter holding well over 85 percent as on March 31, 2025.

items.title: Why this mid-sized old private bank is a candidate for long-term portfolio
items.description: Steady execution and reasonable valuation make a case for long-term investment and accumulation on decline

items.title: Hindustan Zinc shares plunge 3%, extend losses for seventh session: Should you buy, sell or hold?
items.description: Hindustan Zinc share price: The losing streak comes after a four-day gaining streak, during which the stock gained as much as 20% amid significant jump in silver prices.

items.title: Sensex, Nifty trade flat as IT, PSU bank, metal stocks drag; small, midcaps down 1%
items.description: India VIX fell 1.89 percent to 14.01, indicating low volatility even as markets remained choppy.

items.title: Mutual funds lead DIIs as June equity inflow stays strong in follow up to May
items.description: In total, DIIs have infused more than Rs 1.25 lakh crore into equities between May and June so far, with mutual funds contributing around Rs 89,000 crore during this period. In contrast, FIIs have turned net sellers in Indian equities in June so far after two consecutive months of net buying.

items.title: Metal, realty stocks tumble up to 3% as US Fed's hawkish stance weighs in
items.description: Both Nifty Realty and Nifty Metal indices have now extended losses for the third consecutive session, and are currently among the top sectoral losers on the stock market.

items.title: Nifty 50 Top Losers: Tech Mahindra, Adani Ports, TCS stocks drag in today's session
items.description: With Tech Mahindra, Adani Ports, TCS, HCL Tech, and Adani Enterprises experiencing declines, monitoring their performance and broader market trends remains crucial for investors.

items.title: Nifty 50 Top Gainers: IndusInd Bank, Titan Company, Eicher Motors Stock Lead in Today's Session
items.description: The gains observed in IndusInd Bank, Titan Company, and Eicher Motors reflect intraday activity within the NIFTY 50, with each company demonstrating its financial performance.
